dialog.speaker: Cliente
dialog.spanish: Disculpe, ¿cuánto cuesta este vestido?
dialog.english: Excuse me, how much does this dress cost?

dialog.speaker: Vendedora
dialog.spanish: Cuesta cincuenta dólares. Es un poco caro, pero es muy bonito.
dialog.english: It costs fifty dollars. It's a little expensive, but it's very pretty.

dialog.speaker: Cliente
dialog.spanish: Es verdad. ¿Tiene una oferta?
dialog.english: It's true. Do you have a sale?

dialog.speaker: Vendedora
dialog.spanish: Sí, lo tenemos en oferta por cuarenta dólares.
dialog.english: Yes, we have it on sale for forty dollars.

dialog.speaker: Cliente
dialog.spanish: ¡Perfecto! Lo voy a comprar.
dialog.english: Perfect! I am going to buy it.

questions.question: ¿Cuánto cuesta el vestido con la oferta?
¿Qué significa 'Lo voy a comprar'?
options: I am going to buy it
questions.answer: I am going to buy it

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: Necesito ir al supermercado. Mi refrigerador está vacío.
dialog.english: I need to go to the supermarket. My refrigerator is empty.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Yo también. Necesito comprar leche y pan.
dialog.english: Me too. I need to buy milk and bread.

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: Yo compré frutas y verduras ayer, así que hoy solo necesito carne.
dialog.english: I bought fruits and vegetables yesterday, so today I only need meat.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Vamos juntos. Yo pago con tarjeta de crédito, ¿y tú?
dialog.english: Let's go together. I'll pay with a credit card, and you?

dialog.speaker: Laura
dialog.spanish: Yo siempre pago con efectivo.
dialog.english: I always pay with cash.

questions.question: ¿Cómo paga Laura?
options: Paga con la tarjeta de Carlos

dialog.speaker: Marcos
dialog.spanish: Necesito ahorrar dinero para comprar una bicicleta nueva.
dialog.english: I need to save money to buy a new bike.

dialog.speaker: Silvia
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué buena idea! Yo compré una bicicleta el mes pasado.
dialog.english: What a good idea! I bought a bicycle last month.

dialog.speaker: Marcos
dialog.spanish: ¿Fue muy cara?
dialog.english: Was it very expensive?

dialog.speaker: Silvia
dialog.spanish: No, no fue cara. La compré en oferta. Costó solo cien dólares.
dialog.english: No, it wasn't expensive. I bought it on sale. It cost only one hundred dollars.

dialog.speaker: Marcos
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué suerte! Voy a buscar una oferta.
dialog.english: How lucky! I'm going to look for a sale.

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: Tengo que ir a la tienda a comprar ropa para el trabajo.
dialog.english: I have to go to the store to buy clothes for work.

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: Yo también. Necesito un pantalón nuevo y una camisa.
dialog.english: Me too. I need new pants and a shirt.

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: Yo hice mi lista de compras. Voy a comprar un vestido y un abrigo.
dialog.english: I made my shopping list. I am going to buy a dress and a coat.

dialog.speaker: David
dialog.spanish: ¿Vas a pagar con tarjeta?
dialog.english: Are you going to pay with a card?

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: Sí, voy a pagar con la tarjeta de crédito.
dialog.english: Yes, I am going to pay with the credit card.

questions.question: ¿Por qué va Julia a la tienda?

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Mira qué bonitos zapatos. ¿Cuánto costaron?
dialog.english: Look at these pretty shoes. How much did they cost?

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Costaron ochenta dólares. No fueron baratos, pero los necesitaba.
dialog.english: They cost eighty dollars. They weren't cheap, but I needed them.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Entiendo. ¿Pagaste con tarjeta?
dialog.english: I understand. Did you pay with a card?

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Sí, pagué con tarjeta de crédito. La tienda me dio el recibo.
dialog.english: Yes, I paid with a credit card. The store gave me the receipt.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Te quedaron muy bien. Valió la pena el precio.
dialog.english: They look great on you. They were worth the price.

sentences.spanish: El sábado pasado, mi amiga Ana y yo fuimos de compras. Fuimos a una tienda de ropa.
sentences.english: Last Saturday, my friend Ana and I went shopping. We went to a clothing store.

sentences.spanish: Yo necesitaba un pantalón y Ana quería un vestido. La tienda tenía una oferta.
sentences.english: I needed a pair of pants and Ana wanted a dress. The store had a sale.

sentences.spanish: Encontré un pantalón muy bonito y Ana encontró un vestido. Ambos no fueron caros.
sentences.english: I found a very nice pair of pants and Ana found a dress. Both were not expensive.

sentences.spanish: Fuimos a la caja para pagar. Yo pagué con mi tarjeta de crédito y Ana pagó con efectivo.
sentences.english: We went to the checkout to pay. I paid with my credit card and Ana paid with cash.

sentences.spanish: Después, fuimos a una cafetería. Fue un día de compras divertido.
sentences.english: Afterwards, we went to a cafe. It was a fun shopping day.

sentences.spanish: Quiero comprar un nuevo televisor. Pero los televisores son muy caros.
sentences.english: I want to buy a new television. But televisions are very expensive.

sentences.spanish: Necesito ahorrar dinero. Por eso, no voy de compras cada semana.
sentences.english: I need to save money. Because of this, I don't go shopping every week.

sentences.spanish: El mes pasado, no compré nada de ropa. Pagué todas mis facturas con efectivo.
sentences.english: Last month, I didn't buy any clothes. I paid all my bills with cash.

sentences.spanish: Voy a comprar el televisor cuando tenga suficiente dinero.
sentences.english: I am going to buy the television when I have enough money.

sentences.spanish: Espero encontrar una oferta. Eso me ayudaría mucho.
sentences.english: I hope to find a sale. That would help me a lot.

sentences.spanish: Todos los domingos voy al mercado del pueblo con mi abuela. Ella ama el mercado.
sentences.english: Every Sunday I go to the town market with my grandmother. She loves the market.

sentences.spanish: En el mercado, hay muchas tiendas pequeñas y los precios son baratos.
sentences.english: In the market, there are many small stores and the prices are cheap.

sentences.spanish: La semana pasada, mi abuela compró frutas, verduras y pescado. Le costó poco dinero.
sentences.english: Last week, my grandmother bought fruits, vegetables, and fish. It cost her little money.

sentences.spanish: Mi abuela siempre paga con efectivo. Ella dice que el efectivo es más simple.
sentences.english: My grandmother always pays with cash. She says that cash is simpler.

sentences.spanish: Yo le ayudé a llevar las bolsas a casa. Fue un día muy agradable.
sentences.english: I helped her carry the bags home. It was a very pleasant day.

speaking.title: De Compras y Dinero
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas para practicar conversaciones sobre compras, precios y dinero.

question.english: What do you need to buy today?

answer.spanish: Necesito comprar comida para la cena.
answer.english: I need to buy food for dinner.

question.english: Where do you go shopping?

answer.spanish: Yo voy al supermercado y al mercado.
answer.english: I go to the supermarket and the market.

question.english: How much does this shirt cost?

answer.spanish: Cuesta veinte dólares.
answer.english: It costs twenty dollars.

question.english: How are you going to pay?

answer.spanish: Voy a pagar con tarjeta de crédito.
answer.english: I am going to pay with a credit card.

question.english: What did you buy last Saturday?

answer.spanish: Compré unos zapatos nuevos.
answer.english: I bought some new shoes.

question.english: Is the price expensive?

answer.spanish: No, no es caro. Es un buen precio.
answer.english: No, it's not expensive. It's a good price.

question.spanish: ¿Prefieres pagar con efectivo o con tarjeta?
question.english: Do you prefer to pay with cash or with a card?

answer.spanish: Prefiero pagar con efectivo.
answer.english: I prefer to pay with cash.

question.english: Do you need to save money?

answer.spanish: Sí, necesito ahorrar para un viaje.
answer.english: Yes, I need to save for a trip.

question.english: Is there a sale at the store?

answer.spanish: Sí, hay una oferta en todos los pantalones.
answer.english: Yes, there is a sale on all pants.

question.english: What did you buy at the market?

answer.spanish: Compré frutas y verduras frescas.
answer.english: I bought fresh fruits and vegetables.

question.english: Is the receipt important?

answer.spanish: Sí, el recibo es importante por si acaso.
answer.english: Yes, the receipt is important just in case.

question.english: Who is the seller?

answer.spanish: El vendedor es la persona que trabaja en la tienda.
answer.english: The seller is the person who works in the store.

question.english: Do you like to go shopping?

answer.spanish: No, no me gusta ir de compras. Me aburro.
answer.english: No, I don't like to go shopping. I get bored.

question.english: Where is the checkout?

answer.spanish: La caja está al final de la tienda.
answer.english: The checkout is at the end of the store.

question.spanish: ¿Qué vas a comprar en la tienda de ropa?
question.english: What are you going to buy at the clothing store?

answer.spanish: Voy a comprar un vestido y un abrigo.
answer.english: I am going to buy a dress and a coat.

question.english: What did you pay for last month?

answer.spanish: Pagué por la comida y la ropa.
answer.english: I paid for food and clothes.

question.english: Do you have a shopping list?

answer.spanish: Sí, siempre hago una lista de compras.
answer.english: Yes, I always make a shopping list.

question.english: Is this store expensive or cheap?

answer.spanish: Esta tienda es un poco cara.
answer.english: This store is a little expensive.

question.english: What does the customer need?

answer.spanish: El cliente necesita ayuda para encontrar un producto.
answer.english: The customer needs help to find a product.

question.english: Are you going to save money for something?

answer.spanish: Sí, voy a ahorrar para comprar una computadora nueva.
answer.english: Yes, I am going to save to buy a new computer.
